page.title: 04COMMUNICATIONS AROUND BERROW
page.content: Despite the scattered community, {mail}is collected punctually from postboxes, usually twice a day. Few people need to walk for more than ten minutes to reach a postbox. Two{post {offices}in this block provide the usual postal services. As both are food and general supply shops as well, this is fairly convenient, though many people have a long way to come either by car or cycle.{Phone boxes}are well placed, but too few in number. They are well kept and engineers are prompt when breakdowns occur. There are very many{private phones}in the area, connected to automatic exchanges at Bromesberrow or Birtsmorton.{Mail}is delivered once or twice a day in small vans. Postmen will also take letters for posting.
